snippet: The recruitment of Gary Gensler, a former Wall Street regulator, as chief financial officer was meant to show the Clinton campaign is serious about avoiding the overspending of the 2008 campaign, said people briefed on the matter.
abstract: Recruitment of former top federal regulator Gary Gensler as chief financial officer for Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential campaign appears to be reflection of her determination to avoid the level of overspending that plagued her 2008 campaign.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and AMY CHOZICK

lead_paragraph: The recruitment of Gary Gensler, a former Wall Street regulator, as chief financial officer was meant to show the Clinton campaign is serious about avoiding the overspending of the 2008 campaign, said people briefed on the matter.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Hiring of C.F.O. Is Called Signal to Possible Donors
headline.print_headline: Clinton Hiring Is Called Signal to Possible Donors
